meanings.definition: Coarse flour made from durum wheat.
meanings.sent1: I used semolina to make bread today.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for semolina to give the bread a nice texture.
meanings.sent3: The semolina flour spilled all over the kitchen, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a sprinkle of semolina, adding a lightness to the room.
meanings.sent5: The semolina looked like tiny grains of sand, ready to be turned into delicious bread.

meanings.definition: A type of pasta made from semolina.
meanings.sent1: I prefer the pasta made with semolina over other types.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served a delicious dish of semolina pasta.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the semolina pasta was so long, it could be used as a jump rope.
meanings.sent4: The semolina pasta twisted and turned on the plate like a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the semolina pasta filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: A dish made from semolina, typically sweetened and served as a dessert.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's semolina pudding is my favorite dessert.
meanings.sent2: The bakery offered a variety of semolina desserts.
meanings.sent3: The semolina dessert was so sweet, it made my teeth ache.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as a bowl of semolina pudding.
meanings.sent5: The semolina dessert melted in my mouth, leaving a delightful taste behind.
